market_summary: XRP down 5.1% to $1.36 amid extreme fear environment (F&G: 5). ETF outflows persist with -$7.9K daily, -$5.5M weekly flows signaling institutional retreat.
thesis_pulse: SBI Holdings' ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards marks significant Japanese institutional expansion, validating Japan adoption thesis ahead of schedule. However, sustained ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) and extreme fear (F&G: 5) create headwinds. RLUSD circulation at $1.56B (31% to kill switch target) shows steady progress. USD/JPY at 155.21 approaches elevated stress threshold.

stress_assessment.interpretation: Extreme fear index at 5 signals broad market stress. USD/JPY at 155.21 nearing critical threshold. JGB yields at 2.24% indicate BOJ credibility strain amid global rate pressures.

kill_switch_updates.name: japan_adoption
kill_switch_updates.reasoning: SBI Holdings ¥10B blockchain bond with XRP rewards represents major institutional expansion beyond previous AWAJ ecosystem development

scorecard_updates.reasoning: SBI blockchain bond launch exceeds Q3 2026 expectations for Japanese institutional adoption

alerts.message: Sustained XRP ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) amid extreme fear environment signal institutional confidence strain
USD/JPY at 155.21 approaching elevated stress threshold of 155+
SBI blockchain bond launch validates Japan adoption thesis timing

etf_analysis: Persistent outflows continue with -$7.9K daily, -$5.5M weekly across multiple funds. Total AUM at $1.14B (23% to $5B kill switch target) shows institutional retreat amid broader market stress.
macro_analysis: Extreme fear (F&G: 5) dominates sentiment while USD/JPY at 155.21 approaches stress threshold. JGB yields at 2.24% suggest BOJ credibility issues as global rate environment remains elevated.

recommended_probability_adjustment.reasoning: SBI blockchain bond strengthens Japan adoption case, shifting 5% from base to mid despite ETF outflow headwinds

events_draft.title: SBI Holdings Launches ¥10B Blockchain Bond With XRP Rewards
events_draft.expanded: Major Japanese financial institution deepens XRPL integration with tokenized bond offering, validating Japan adoption thesis ahead of Q3 2026 timeline. Represents institutional expansion beyond AWAJ ecosystem development.

geopolitical_watchlist.status_text: JGB yields at 2.24% signal credibility strain as USD/JPY approaches 155.21 stress threshold amid global rate pressures.
Strait of Hormuz remains critical with dual carrier groups deployed amid Russia-Iran-China naval exercises.
Section 122 tariffs (10% global) continue with ~145 days remaining until July expiration.
SCOTUS-struck IEEPA tariffs replaced by Section 122 framework, maintaining trade tension through mid-2026.
Naval exercises with Iran and China in critical shipping lanes maintain elevated geopolitical risk.

energy_interpretation: Brent crude at $69.77 remains below elevated thresholds despite Hormuz tensions, providing some relief to Japan's trade deficit pressures. However, JPY weakness at 155.21 amplifies import costs, creating feedback loop that pressures BOJ credibility as JGB yields climb to 2.24%.
thesis_pulse_assessment: SBI blockchain bond validates Japan adoption ahead of schedule, but sustained ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) signal institutional confidence strain. RLUSD at $1.56B shows 31% progress to kill switch while extreme fear (F&G: 5) creates headwinds. Core thesis infrastructure advancing despite macro stress.
stress_interpretation: Elevated stress environment with extreme fear index at 5 indicating broad market distress. USD/JPY at 155.21 approaches critical 155+ threshold while JGB yields at 2.24% suggest BOJ credibility issues. Multiple stress vectors converging but not yet critical.

bear_case.score_reasoning: ETF outflows accelerating (-$5.5M weekly) amid extreme fear suggest institutional retreat. However, SBI bond launch provides counter-evidence to adoption stagnation narrative.

bear_case.bear_narrative: Accelerating ETF outflows (-$5.5M weekly) during extreme fear environment suggest institutional confidence eroding faster than adoption news can offset. BIS Project Nexus represents credible multi-CBDC alternative that could bypass XRPL entirely. Macro stress (F&G: 5, USD/JPY 155.21) threatens to overwhelm positive adoption signals.
